intro: Aeluropus sinaicus, commonly known as the Sinai sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a perennial grass that thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found in coastal and desert environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a valuable species for ecological restoration projects in arid landscapes.
